title: store_location!() method gets wrong location after timeout
body:
I posted this one in Google Groups first based on my own application. I now created a brand new demo app with just Rails 3.2.13 and Devise 2.2.4 configured with devise :database_authenticatable, :timeoutable. I'm using just a Person and Product model.

The same unexpected result pop ups here too. What's the case:

When I'm in an edit form (edit controller action) and my time-out expired then I submit the form. The Sign in form arises to request my credentials again and then redirects back to the form I was in. Alas, it should do so, but it doesn't. It redirects back to the show form. On a create action it redirects back to the index action. Here's my log:

Started PUT "/products/1" 
Processing by ProductsController#update as HTML
  Parameters: {"utf8"=>"âœ“",  "product"=>{"name"=>"kabeljouw"}, "commit"=>"Update Product", "id"=>"1"}
  Person Load (0.3ms)  SELECT `people`.\* FROM `people` WHERE `people`.`id` = 1 LIMIT 1
Completed 401 Unauthorized in 1ms

Started GET "/products/1"
Processing by ProductsController#show as HTML
  Parameters: {"id"=>"1"}
Completed 401 Unauthorized in 0ms

Started GET "/people/sign_in"
Processing by Devise::SessionsController#new as HTML
  Rendered .../ruby-1.9.3-p392/gems/devise-2.2.4/app/views/devise/shared/_links.erb (0.8ms)
  Rendered .../ruby-1.9.3-p392/gems/devise-2.2.4/app/views/devise/sessions/new.html.erb within layouts/application (5.3ms)
Completed 200 OK in 40ms (Views: 39.4ms | ActiveRecord: 0.0ms)

In theory the store_location!() method records the last GET request to redirect back to. That should be the edit action on the controller. But after authentication an extra GET request is generated (/products/1) and thus saved by store_location!(). 

Where does this extra GET request come from? It looks like it ain't the Rails framework. There is no Redirect_to log message. This extra GET request should not be there or should not be recorded by store_location!() in order to get the expected user experience.
